attributes.action: Suspend or reduce hours of operation of Bus lanes in London.
attributes.additional_details: In the past 2 months TFL has introduced 24hour operations of bus lanes to encourge people using Public transport, however now we are encouraged to use private transport, so bus lanes should be suspeneded to reduce traffic, polution and help people and encourgae them to go to work and keep the economy going.
attributes.background: Bus lanes are to encourge people using Public transport, however as the advice from the goverment currently is to avoid using public transport, bus lines operation hours should be rolled back to day only, or even reduce or abolish bus lanes until Covid is over.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. Bus lanes in London are the responsibility of TfL and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
